get.description: Hotel Search uses pagination by default. The initial search response returns 25 properties, notes the total number of properties found, and includes an identifier to be used for retrieving additional pages. Call the GET pagination endpoint to retrieve each additional page of 25 properties until the end of the list is reached.The identifier used for paging is saved for 30 minutes. A new hotel search request must be performed after it expires.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: The Identifier of the Properties from which a page is to be returned

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to be returned

get.description: Retrieve details about a held booking, or PNR. While a PNR refers to a held booking that has not been ticketed, the PNR code persists after ticketing to provide the booking records. Once a PNR has been ticketed, you can still use PNR Retrieve to return both booking and ticketing details. A Ticket Display request can also be used to retrieve any ticketed itinerary.

parameters.name: Identifier
parameters.description: Identifier provides the ability to create a globally unique identifier. For the identifier to be globally unique it must have a system provided identifier and the system must be identified using a global naming authority. System identification uses the domain naming system (DNS) to assure they are globally unique and should be an URL. The system provided ID will typically be a primary or surrogate key in a database.

parameters.name: detailViewInd
parameters.description: If true, ReservationDetail will be returned.

parameters.name: identifierType
parameters.description: The type of identifier key used to retrieve the reservation

parameters.name: TraceId
parameters.description: Identifier used to correlate API invocations across long-running or multi-call business flows.

parameters.name: XAUTH_TRAVELPORT_ACCESSGROUP
parameters.description: Identifies the Travelport access group with which the caller is associated

put.description: The Modify Reservation request can modify an existing reservation by changing any of the following - dates, payment information, traveler first and/or last name. You can also add comments to an existing reservation. Hotel Modify can be used only for Travelport itineraries at this time. When changing dates Travelport recommends that you first send an availability request for the new dates and look for the same booking code that is on the existing reservation. An availability request is not mandatory, but a modify request will fail if the new dates are not available.

transactionId.description: Unique transaction, correlation or tracking id for a single request and reply i.e. for a single transaction. Should be a 128 bit GUID format. Also know as E2ETrackingId.

traceId.description: Optional ID for internal child transactions created for processing a single request (single transaction). Should be a 128 bit GUID format. Also known as ChildTrackingId.

System identification uses the domain naming system (DNS) to assure they are globally unique and should be an URL. The system provided ID will typically be a primary or surrogate key in a database.

numberOfRatePlans.description: Minimum number rate plans requested in response

propertyDatesRef.description: Refers to PropertyDates object in the ReferenceList_PropertyDates

bookingCode.description: Booking code retrieved from the Availability response.

propertyName.description: The name of the hotel property

Sequence.description: Sequence determines the order in which the offer shall be displayed to the customer

limitedAvailabilityInd.description: If true the offering\/Offer has limited availability

City.description: City (e.g., Dublin), town, or postal station (i.e., a postal service territory, often used in a military address).

SearchAirport.description: Properties located near this IATA airport code

SearchCity.description: Properties located near this IATA city code

Latitude.description: The measure of the angular distance on a meridan north or south equator

Longitude.description: The measure of the angular distance on a meridan east or west equator

includedinBaseInd.description: If the fee is included in the Base Price

TotalSurcharges.description: A monetary amount, up to 4 decimal places. Decimal place needs to be included.

approximateInd.description: if true, the surcharge amounts are approximate

SourceID.description: The identifier of the source system sending the error or warning

SourceCode.description: The error or warning code returned by the source airline or host system

SourceDescription.description: The error or warning message as it is returned by the source airline or host system

Message.description: The Travelport standardized error or warning message

SourceID.description: The identifier of the source system sending the error or warning

SourceCode.description: The error or warning code returned by the source airline or host system

SourceDescription.description: The error or warning message as it is returned by the source airline or host system

SourceID.description: The identifier of the source system sending the error or warning

SourceCode.description: The error or warning code returned by the source airline or host system

SourceDescription.description: The error or warning message as it is returned by the source airline or host system

locatorType.description: Specifies the type of reservation ID

source.description: Specifies a unique identifier to indicate the source system which generated the resid

sourceContext.description: Specifies the context of the source

Locator.description: Contains the locator (PNR or external locator) or cancellation number for the reservation, order, or offer

flightRefs.description: The flightRefs the status is applicable to within the Offer

pastDateInd.description: If true, the flight is considered to be past date

depositInd.description: if true, the receipt is for a deposit or prepayment

guaranteeInd.description: if true, the receipt is for a guarantee only. Guarantee rules are in accordance with the Offer TermsAndConditions.

Number.description: The identifying number of the document

reasonCode.description: A code assigned to identify the reason for disruption

Base.description: The price prior to all applicable taxes of a product such as the rate for a room or fare for a flight.

Total.description: Specifies the total price including base + taxes + fees

approximateInd.description: True if this amount has been converted from the original amount

agentNonRefundableInd.description: This indicates that the Cash payment should not be refunded

inhibitPaymentCardAuthorizationInd.description: If true, the payment card will not go through card authorization process

id.description: Payment card reference ID.

CardCode.description: Specifies the two character code (MC, VI, AX, etc) for the payment card (open enumeration)

CardHolderName.description: Name as displayed on Payment Card

secureInd.description: Implementer: If true, all or a portion of this data is secure, via tokenization, encryption and\/or masking.

id.description: Optional internally referenced id

optInDate.description: The datetime of receiving the opt in notice

optOutDate.description: The datetime the opt out notice was received

PaymentCardTypeIssuer.description: This object contains Cards details for Payment

encryptionKey.description: Note: This contains a key required to retrieve the full payment instrument details compliant with PCI DSS standards.

encryptionKeyMethod.description: Developer: This contains a reference to the key generation method being used - this is NOT the key value.

encryptionMethod.description: OpenTravel Best Practice: Encryption Method: When using the OpenTravel Encryption element, it is RECOMMENDED that all trading partners be informed of all encryption methods being used in advance of implementation to ensure message processing compatibility.

tokenProviderID.description: Developer: This contains a provider ID if multiple providers are used for secure information exchange.

PlainText.description: Don't use this unless it is REALLY ok to not use encryption. Non-secure (plain text) value.

forfeitInd.description: If true, this form of payment instruction is to forfeit residual amounts specified in an Offer. Used in conjunction with Payment to specify which amounts to be forfeited

accountNumber.description: The account number for the Form of payment BSP

InvoiceNumber.description: The invoice number applicable to this form of payment. Send null or empty string if no invoice number specified.

extendedPaymentInd.description: Implementer: If true, the credit card company is requested to delay the date on which the amount of this transaction is applied to the customer's account.

enettInd.description: True if this payment card has been issued through Enett

thirdPartyInd.description: If true, then the payment card holder is not one of the travelers in the reservation

acceptanceOverrideInd.description: If true, override airline restriction on the payment card

signatureOnFileInd.description: When true, indicates a signature has been obtained.

expireDateExclusiveInd.description: When true, indicates that the ExpireDate is the first day after the applicable period (e.g. when expire date is Oct 15  the last date of the period is Oct 14).

DateEffectiveExpire.description: Used to identify the effective date and\/or expiration date.

xID.description: Merchants must ensure that each Payer Authentication Request (PAReq) contains a unique combination of account ID and XID

eCI.description: Electronic Commerce Indicator - 3-D secure data, contact your authenticator for rules and downline processing.

uCAFIndicator.description: Universal Card Authentication Field MasterCard only UCAF is the mechanism that is used to transmit the AAV from the merchant to issuer for authentication purposes during the authorization process

AlternateEmailAddress.description: The alternate agency email to be used for correspondence with this virtual payment

PaymentComment.description: Optional text to be sent to the supplier

AlternateHotelFax.description: Hotel fax number to be used if the hotel fax is unknown or not provided in Property details

MaximumChargeableAmount.description: The maximum amount that the supplier may charge to the payment card including room rate and any incidentals specified

IncidentalCharges.description: List of incidentals that are permitted to be charged to the virtual payment card.

TraceId.name: TraceId
TraceId.description: Identifier used to correlate API invocations across long-running or multi-call business flows.

XAUTH_TRAVELPORT_ACCESSGROUP.name: XAUTH_TRAVELPORT_ACCESSGROUP
XAUTH_TRAVELPORT_ACCESSGROUP.description: Identifies the Travelport access group with which the caller is associated

TravelportPlusSessionID.name: TravelportPlusSessionID
TravelportPlusSessionID.description: Travelport Plus Session ID used to maintain an established agency session
